CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Sales Department?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Sales Department is arc {IT Department}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Sales Department?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Sales Department is arc {Legal Department}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Sales Department} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Marketing Department} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Legal Department to Marketing Department in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Sales Department to Legal Department in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Legal Department to Sales Department in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Legal Department and Marketing Department in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Legal Department and Marketing Department is {364}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Marketing Department and IT Department in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Marketing Department and IT Department is {42}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from IT Department?
SC.A: The total flow output from IT Department is {53}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by IT Department?
SC.A: The total flow input by IT Department is {678}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 339? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {364} from {Legal Department} to {Marketing Department}, a flow of {369} from {Sales Department} to {Marketing Department}, a flow of {352} from {Marketing Department} to {IT Department}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 164? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {140} from {Marketing Department} to {Legal Department}, a flow of {11} from {IT Department} to {Sales Department}, a flow of {42} from {IT Department} to {Marketing Department}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 164 and 293? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {201} from {Legal Department} to {Sales Department}, a flow of {188} from {Sales Department} to {Legal Department}, a flow of {260} from {Marketing Department} to {Sales Department}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Sales Department to Marketing Department or from Legal Department to Marketing Department?
NC.A: The flow from {Sales Department} to {Marketing Department} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Legal Department to Sales Department, from Legal Department to Marketing Department, or from Sales Department to Marketing Department?
NC.A: The flow from {Sales Department} to {Marketing Department} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Sales Department}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Marketing Department} and {Sales Department}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc IT Department, Arc Marketing Department, Arc Sales Department, Arc Legal Department}.
